A: 1. Modern towns are settlements of people in _ time (a) ancient (b) recent (c) distant
2. Which of these is NOT an ancient town mentioned in the text? (a) Ile-Ife (b) Lagos (c) Benin
3. Benin City is the present capital of _ state (a) Oyo (b) Edo (c) Osun
4. The Benin Kingdom had a historical relationship with the _ (a) Hausas (b) Igbos (c) Yorubas
5. Oba Ewuare came to power in Benin in the year _ (a) 1540 (b) 1440 (c) 1340
6. Benin became famous for its art of Bronze, Iron and _ (a) Gold (b) Silver (c) Ivory
7. Benin City is also known as _ (a) Ife (b) Edonokhodu (c) Oba City
8. The traditional ruler of Benin is known as _ (a) Emir (b) Oba (c) Sultan
9. Ile-Ife is an ancient Yoruba city located in _ state (a) Edo (b) Osun (c) Kano
10. The Yoruba people refer to Ile-Ife as their _ home (a) modern (b) ancestral (c) temporary
11. Ile-Ife is known for its ancient and indigenous bronze, artworks, stone and _ sculptures (a) plastic (b) wood (c) terra-cotta
12. _ is regarded as the father of Yoruba race (a) Oranmiyan (b) Oba Ewuare (c) Oduduwa
13. Oranmiyan was an oba in Ile-Ife and the son of _ (a) Oba Ewuare (b) Oduduwa (c) Sango
14. The Yoruba believe their civilization began in _ (a) Benin (b) Kano (c) Ile-Ife
15. Kano is an ancient town located in _ State Nigeria (a) Osun (b) Edo (c) Kano
16. Ancient towns are towns that have been in existence for a _ time (a) short (b) long (c) recent
17. The city where the gods first came when they got to the earth, according to Yoruba belief, is _ (a) Benin (b) Ile-Ife (c) Lagos
18. Oba Ewuare developed a great _ culture in Benin (a) agricultural (b) artistic (c) military
19. Which of the following is an example of an ancient town mentioned? (a) Abuja (b) Port Harcourt (c) Calabar
20. Towns have their origins, mode of dressing, language, and _ (a) climate (b) festival (c) economy
